com.pb.sawdust.util.test

Class TestRunner

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.util.test.TestRunner

  • public class TestRunner
extends java.lang.Object
    The TestRunner class provides a simple framework for running jUnit tests. The reason for using it (instead of the built-in jUnit runners) is to incorporate additional test reporting: test class, test name, additional test information, and test duration. This additional reporting is optional, and only available from tests which extend TestBase or use the @RunWith(TestRunner.TimerRunner) annotation.

    This class can be used to write information to output streams attached to this class. By default, System.out is attached, but it is also possible to attach (or detach) other java.io.OutputStreams.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  TestRunner.TimerRunner
      The TimeRunner class extends the base jUnit test runner to include test duration information.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static TestRunner getInstance()
        Geta a TestRunner instance. There will be a separate instance for each thread.
        Returns:
        the test runner.

      • setDetailedReporting

        public void setDetailedReporting(boolean detailedReporting)
        Specify if the runner should provide detail reporting for the test classes that support it. Detailed reporting includes listing the name of the test class being run, the name of the test method being run, the test execution time, and any additional test information set through this class. If set to false, then the default "dots" behavior of jUnit will be used. The class default is to have detailed reporting turned on.
        Parameters:
        detailedReporting - true if detailed reporting is to be used, false if not.

      • runTests

        public org.junit.runner.Result runTests(java.lang.Class... testClasses)
        Run the tests in a series of specified classes. The test classes should each have at least one method annotated with @Test. If the test classes inherit from TestBase, and detailed reporting is turned on, the detailed reports for those tests will be printed.
        Parameters:
        testClasses - The classes holding the test methods to run.
        Returns:
        the result of the test run.

      • getCurrentTestDuration

        public long getCurrentTestDuration()
        Get the duration for the current test to finish. If the test has not finished, or if this method is called from a thread in which no test is currently being run, then null will be returned.
        Returns:
        the duration of time it took to run the current test most recently finished in this thread.

      • setAdditionalTestInformation

        public void setAdditionalTestInformation(java.lang.String additionalTestInformation)
        Set additional test information for tests run from this thread. This information is reported in the detailed test reports created by this class. This information is only valid for tests run from the same thread that called this method.
        Parameters:
        additionalTestInformation - Additional test information to use with this test.

      • getAdditionalTestInformation

        public java.lang.String getAdditionalTestInformation()
        Get the additional test information last set from this thread through setAdditionalTestInfomration. If that method has not been called, then an empty string will be returned.
        Returns:
        the additional test information preveiously set in this thread.

      • writeTextToOutput

        public static void writeTextToOutput(java.lang.String text)
        Write some text to the output stream(s) attached to this class.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to write.

      • writeLineToOutput

        public static void writeLineToOutput(java.lang.String text)
        Write a line text to the output stream(s) attached to this class.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to write. A new line will be added to the printed text.

      • flushOutput

        public static void flushOutput()
        Flush the output to all of the streams attached to this class.

      • addOutputStream

        public static void addOutputStream(java.io.PrintStream output)
        Attach an output stream for writing text to from this class.
        Parameters:
        output - The output stream to attach.

      • removeOutputStream

        public static void removeOutputStream(java.io.PrintStream output)
        Detach an ouput stream from this class. It will be flushed upon removal.
        Parameters:
        output - The output stream to detach.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String... args)
        Main method which runs all of the classes entered as arguments. The class names should be the fully qualified names.
        Parameters:
        args - The test classes to run.
